meanings.definition: A person who is physically or emotionally weak.
meanings.sent1: The playground bully always targeted the weaklings.
meanings.sent2: The coach encouraged the weaklings to keep practicing and get stronger.
meanings.sent3: The weaklings in the race tried to hop on one foot to the finish line.
meanings.sent4: In the forest, the weaklings were the delicate flowers easily trampled by giants.
meanings.sent5: The teacher reminded the class to be kind to the weaklings and help them when needed.

meanings.definition: A group of people who lack strength or power.
meanings.sent1: The weaklings banded together to support each other in the face of adversity.
meanings.sent2: The kingdom was overrun by the strong warriors, leaving only the weaklings behind.
meanings.sent3: The weaklings formed a secret club where they could share their favorite snacks.
meanings.sent4: In the political arena, the weaklings were the small parties struggling to be heard.
meanings.sent5: The weaklings huddled in the corner, hoping to avoid the attention of the bullies.
